array.string: If I don‘t reach the bus then I have to take a taxi.
if not p then q
I reach the bus; I take a taxi
¬p → q
I will be late when I don‘t reach the bus
if not p then q
I will be late; I reach the bus
¬p → q
If I buy a car I can't buy a boat.
if p then not q
I buy a car; I can buy a boat
p → ¬q
If the barmoter falls, then it will rain or it will snow.
if p then q or r
the barometer falls; it will rains; it will snow
p → q ∨ r
When the sun shines today, it won‘t shine tommorrow.
if p then not q
the sun shines today; it will shine tommorow
p → ¬q
Robert was jealous of Yvonne, or he was not in a good mood.
p or not q
Robert was jealous of Yvonne; he was in a good mood
p ∨ ¬ q
If interest rates go up, share prices go down.
if not p or not q then not r
interest rates go up; share prices go down
p → q
No shoes, no shirt, no service
if not p or not q then not r
shoes, shirt, service
If Dick met Jane yesterday, they had a cup of coffee together or they took a walk in the park
if p then q or r
Dick met Jane yesterday; they had a cup of coffee together; they took a walk in the park
p → q ∨ r
Today it will rain or shine, but not both
p or q and not p and q
will rain; shine; both
p → q ∨ ¬r
If Smith has installed central heating, then he has sold his car or he has not paid his mortage
if p then q or not r
Smith has installed central heating; he has sold his car; he has not paid his mortage
